comment.author: 13706945@N00
13706945@N00
comment._content: According to the Montreal Roll of Honour cited above, the adjutant in the Canadian 5th Regiment, Royal Highlanders of Canada in 1914 was a Captain W. Bovey (photo p. 47). His attestation papers (from 1915) are available from Library and Archives Canada: www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.02-e... www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.02-e... This person features also in the genealogy mentioned above, as "Francis Henry 'Wilfrid' BOVEY," (1886-1952), the older brother of Quentin Christopher Drummond Bovey: wc.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=br...

comment.author: 13706945@N00
comment._content: If all this fits, this would make Quentin's father Henry Taylor Bovey (1852-1912), Professor of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics at McGill University from 1877 to 1907: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Bovey See also: www3.imperial.ac.uk/aboutimperial/imperial_people/pastrec... www.biographi.ca/en/bio/redpath_john_9E.html There is also a curious mention of a Quentin Bovey on the Redpath Mansion Mystery pages, presumably from when he was a child (1906): www.canadianmysteries.ca/sites/redpath/bloodties/theredpa... (this also fits, because his mother was a member of the Redpath family)
